fullDescription.intro:
This node allows you to execute arbitrary java code to create a new Spark RDD. Enter the java code in the text area.
You can define reusable templates with the "Create templates..." button. Templates are stored in the users workspace by default and can be accessed via the "Templates" tab.
fullDescription.option: The list contains the flow variables that are currently available at the node input. Double clicking any of the entries will insert the respective identifier at the current cursor position (replacing the selection, if any).
Enter your java code here. You can access flow variables by defining them in the Input table (see Flow Variable List).

StructType getSchema(JavaRDD resultRDD): Overwrite this method to specify the schema of the result RDD. See the "Create result schema manually" template for an example. Otherwise the node tries to guess the result schema by looking at the first 10 rows of the result RDD:
Define system input fields for the snippet text area. Every field will be populated with the data of the defined input during execution.
